snippet: How a marketing fiasco derailed an important medical development.
abstract: Op-Ed article by pediatrics Prof Stanley A Plotkin urges manufacturing of a vaccine for Lyme disease, as number of annual infections may be 300,000 and the tick that carries it is spreading to new areas; cites marketing fiasco in 1998 that derailed development of the vaccine, but holds one can easily be produced if public demand is high and mistakes of past are avoided.
lead_paragraph: How a marketing fiasco derailed an important medical development.
